Description: Black-topped red ware cup made of Nile silt, exterior strongly rippled diagonally and coated with red slip and well burnished to fine lustre, strokes running perpendicular to rippling. Interior is black, horizontally burnished. Rim is milled. Rounded base is slightly flattened, slipped and burnished but not rippled; slightly worn from use.
Curator's comments: Illustrated as Brunton’s (1937) Black-topped Red BR38T but this drawing is not accurate, and the vessel does not have added buff slip at the base. The cup was found near the hands of a child, estimated to be about 12 years of age, in an undisturbed grave.
Bibliographic references: Brunton 1937 / Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture (p. 35; pl. 17.38t)
Condition: fair; slip is flaking off in places, reconstructed from fragments, pieces missing, rim chipped.
